info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 9 at 5:37AM EDT until June 11 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Elliston to Hazleton.
.Rainfall of two to four inches since Friday has brought minor flooding to portions of the White River from Elliston to Hazleton. Much of the river is still rising but flooding should end by late week.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wabash River at Montezuma.
* WHEN...Until late Wednesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Several hundred acres of bottomlands along the right bank from the mouth of Sugar Creek to northern edge of Montezuma begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EDT Monday was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.8 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 845 PM EDT /745 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Parke, IN; Vermillion, IN; Vigo, IN
